_meanings:
a royal
court, the court-yard of a palace.

a king of kings, a supreme king,
paramount sovereign, an emperor.

the capital of a king
metropolis.

a principal
or royal road, main street, highway.

{1} an inferior king, a petty
prince.

{2} a title of respect 
formerly given to distinguished 
scholars and poets.

a
king's edict, an ordinance, a royal
decree.

a diamond of an inferior
quality.

<ab>Ved.</ab> a stand on
which the Soma is placed.

(<ab>pl.</ab>) the paraphernalia
of a king, the insignia of royalty.

a
royal sage, a saint-like prince, a
man of the Kṣatriya caste who, by
his pious life and austere devotion,
comes to be regarded as a sage or
{%rishi%}; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} {#purUravas, janaka, viSvAmitra#}.
a tax or tribute paid to the king.

a person who assists at a 
coronation.

{1} a royal
family, a king's family.

{3} a court of justice;
({#rAjakule kaT#} or {#nivid#} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} means
‘to sue one in a court of law, lodge
a complaint against).

{5} a king, master (as a 
respectful mode of speaking).

escheating to the sovereign (as the
property of a person having no
heir).

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of a chief city in 
Magadha (about 75 or 80 miles from
Pātaliputra).

<ab>N.</ab> of a
celebrated historical poem treating
of the kings of Kāshmīra by 
Kalhaṇa.

{2} a law or rule relating to kings
(<ab>oft.</ab> in <ab>pl.</ab>).

the king's 
residence, the capital, 
metropolis, the seat of government;  
<ls>R. 2. 70.</ls>

the burden or 
responsibility of government.

administration of a state,
administration of government, 
politics, statesmanship.

{2} a Kṣatriya, a man of the 
military tribe.

{2} a female of the
Rajpoota tribe.

a scion of royalty,
of royal descent.

a highway, high road, a royal 

or main road, principal street.

{2} one who fights
with a king.

{1} a 
configuration of planets, asterisms &c. at the
birth of a man which indicates that
he is destined to be a king.

{2} an
easy mode of religious meditation
(fit for kings to practise), as 
distinguished from the more rigorous
one called {#haWapoga#} <ab>q. v.</ab>

{1} a supreme king, sovereign lord,
an emperor.

{1} any mark on a man's
body indicating future royalty.

the fortune
or prosperity of a king (personified
as a goddess), the glory or majesty
of a king; <ls>R. 2. 7.</ls>

a collection of princes
or kings.

a royal
umbrella with a golden handle.

a great sacrifice
performed by a universal monarch
(in which the tributary princes
also took part) at the time of his
coronation as a mark of his 

undisputed sovereignty; {#rAjA vE#} 
{#rAjasUyenezwvAM Bavati#} <ls>Śat. Br.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> {#samrAd#}
also.

a flamingo (a
sort of white goose with red legs
and bill); {#saMpatsyaMte naBasi Bavato#} 
{#rAjahaMsAH sahAyAH#} <ls>Me. 11.</ls>

a
royal elephant, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} a lordly and
handsome elephant.
